title: Design and Learning Effects of Science Education Videos Using Segmented and Generative Activities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental scientific theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Learners individually use tablets or laptops to access videos and engage in generative learning activities through in-class group work. Formative assessment continuously monitors learning progress.

learning_goals: Learners can effectively acquire scientific concepts through segmented video units of three minutes or less.
Learners can achieve over 80% comprehension through generative activities (e.g., concept mapping, problem-solving) after video viewing.
Learners can demonstrate statistically significant improvement (p < 0.05) in pre-post tests after video-based learning.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
